newsitem.title: USA: Office Depot adopts holder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Office Depot adopts holder rights plan.

text.p: Office Depot Inc said Wednesday directors, at their Tuesday meeting, adopted a defensive Preferred Share Purchase Rights Plan and declared a dividend distribution to be made to stockholders of record on September 16 of one Preferred Share Purchase Right on each outstanding common share.
Each Right will entitle stockholders to buy one one-thousandth of a share of a new series of junior participating preferred stock at an exercise price of $95.00.

Noting the rights are intended to protect against an unsolicited acquisition attempt that would not be in the best interests of stockholders, the company said it is not aware of any such attempt at present.
It said the rights will not be triggered by the proposed merger with Staples Inc, which will be treated as an exempt person under the plan.

The rights would be exercisable only if a party other than Stapels acquired, or announced an offer for, 20 percent or more of the Office Depot's common. The company could swap the rights for its common on a one-for-one basis at any time after a party had acquired 20 percent or more of the outstanding stock.
